getCRUCLdata
  • Reference
  • Articles
  • News

Manage locally cached CRU CL v. 2.0 files

The user is given an option when downloading the CRU CL v. 2.0 data to cache or not to cache the data for later use. If cache == TRUE, then the CRU CL v. 2.0 data files are saved in a directory in the users' home file space. These functions provide facilities for interacting and managing these files.

CRU_cache_list()

CRU_cache_delete(files, force = TRUE)

CRU_cache_delete_all(force = TRUE)

CRU_cache_details(files = NULL)

Arguments

files

Character. One or more complete file names with no file path
force

Logical. Should files be force deleted? Defaults to : TRUE

Details

CRU_cache_delete only accepts one file name, while CRU_cache_delete_all does not accept any names, but deletes all files. For deleting many specific files, use cache_delete in a lapply type call.

We files cache using user_cache_dir, find your cache folder by executing rappdirs::user_cache_dir("getCRUCLdata")

Note

These functions were adapted from rOpenSci's cc_cache.

Functions

  • CRU_cache_list() returns a character vector of full path file names

  • CRU_cache_delete() deletes one or more files, returns nothing

  • CRU_cache_delete_all() delete all files, returns nothing

  • CRU_cache_details() prints file name and file size for each file, supply with one or more files, or no files (and get details for all available)

Examples

## Not run: ------------------------------------
# # List files in cache
# CRU_cache_list()
# 
# # List info for single files
# CRU_cache_details(files = CRU_cache_list()[1])
# CRU_cache_details(files = CRU_cache_list()[2])
# 
# # List info for all files
# CRU_cache_details()
# 
# # Delete files by name in cache
# CRU_cache_delete(files = CRU_cache_list()[1])
# 
# # Delete all files in cache
# CRU_cache_delete_all()
## ---------------------------------------------
